items.sentence: I dropped out of school when I was in the 7th grade.
I enjoyed the concert except that the hall was cold.
I especially liked the way you sang the second song.
Tom can\'t believe Mary isn\'t going to do anything.
I\'m fairly certain that\'s what\'s going to happen.
Tom wondered how long John and Mary had been dating.
Tom wondered if he had enough money to pay the bill.
Tom wondered who the man standing near the gate was.
Tom would be able to do that if he really wanted to.
What\'s the number of the fax machine in this hotel?
Why don\'t you come inside and we can talk about it?
I\'d appreciate it if you wouldn\'t do that anymore.
You aren\'t really going to argue with Tom, are you?
You aren\'t really planning on helping Tom, are you?
You can hear the news on the radio at nine o\'clock.
You can easily identify Tom because he is very tall.
I wonder if Tom would really do something like that.
I wonder whether or not I should tell Tom the truth.
I wonder whether or not Tom ever gives Mary flowers.
I wonder whether or not Tom really needs to do that.
